headline: Aptiv Unplugs EDS: Spin-Off Aims To Supercharge Electrification, Automation And AI
summary: Aptiv PLC (NYSE:APTV) shares are trading higher in the premarket session on Wednesday. The company’s Board of Directors has approved a plan to separate its Electrical Distribution Systems (EDS) business from Aptiv, creating two independent entities. Aptiv also reaffirmed its 2024 outlook, with a fourth-quarter earnings report scheduled for February 6, 2025. headline: Aptiv shares jump on plan to separate electrical distribution systems business
summary: (Reuters) -Aptiv said on Wednesday it would separate its electrical distribution systems (EDS) business into a new company, as it looks to focus on its advanced driver-aid technology, sending shares of the auto parts supplier up 5%.  "We think the spin-off of EDS makes sense because it is a much lower-margin business, with an estimated 2024 adjusted EBITDA margin of 9.5% versus 18.8% for the rest of the business," CFRA Research analyst Garrett Nelson said.  The EDS division, which makes crucial power and signal distribution systems for electric vehicles, is expected to be separated by March 31, 2026.

The EDS division, which makes crucial power and signal distribution systems for electric vehicles, is expected to be separated by March 31, 2026.

thumbnail.caption: A driver holds his hands just underneath the steering wheel during a live-demonstration of Aptiv's self-driving vehicle in Las Vegas
